description: Diminutive from Spanish horno (“oven”), Latin furnus. See furnace.

entries.meaning: (geology) A low, oven-shaped mound, common in volcanic regions, emitting smoke and vapours from its sides and summit.
examples: When Humboldt visited this place, the natives assured him that the heat of the hornitos had formerly been much greater. The thermometer rose to 203° when placed in the fissures exhaling aqueous vapour.
